trans-unit.source: Animate a camera with a model file
trans-unit.target: Animate a camera with a model file

trans-unit.source: Beginner Artist
trans-unit.target: Beginner Artist

trans-unit.source: Like other entities, you can animate cameras using animations imported from 3D model files such as .3ds, .fbx, and .obj.
trans-unit.target: Like other entities, you can animate cameras using animations imported from 3D model files such as .3ds, .fbx, and .obj.

trans-unit.source: !Note To animate a camera using a model file, you first need to bake the animation using your modeling tool (eg Maya, 3ds Max or Blender). Stride doesn't support cameras animated using target cameras.
trans-unit.target: !Note To animate a camera using a model file, you first need to bake the animation using your modeling tool (eg Maya, 3ds Max or Blender). Stride doesn't support cameras animated using target cameras.

trans-unit.source: If the camera moves independently, the simplest method is to export the camera animation as a separate file, enable the root motion option on the animation, then add the camera, animation, and animation script to the same entity. If the animations include FOV or near or far plane animations, the Stride camera updates accordingly. With this method, you don't need a model or a skeleton.
trans-unit.target: If the camera moves independently, the simplest method is to export the camera animation as a separate file, enable the root motion option on the animation, then add the camera, animation, and animation script to the same entity. If the animations include FOV or near or far plane animations, the Stride camera updates accordingly. With this method, you don't need a model or a skeleton.

trans-unit.source: If you want the camera to move in tandem with another animation — for example, if the camera is held by a cameraman character with its own model, skeleton and animation — use a model node link component to link the camera entity to the cameraman's movements.
trans-unit.target: If you want the camera to move in tandem with another animation — for example, if the camera is held by a cameraman character with its own model, skeleton and animation — use a model node link component to link the camera entity to the cameraman's movements.

trans-unit.source: To do this, you need the following assets in your project:
trans-unit.target: To do this, you need the following assets in your project:

trans-unit.source: a camera entity, the camera to be animated
trans-unit.target: a camera entity, the camera to be animated

trans-unit.source: an animation, to animate the camera (exported separately in your modeling tool)
trans-unit.target: an animation, to animate the camera (exported separately in your modeling tool)

trans-unit.source: an animation script, to play the animation
trans-unit.target: an animation script, to play the animation

trans-unit.source: In the Asset View, select the animation asset you want to use to animate the camera.
trans-unit.target: In the Asset View, select the animation asset you want to use to animate the camera.

trans-unit.source: Select animation asset
trans-unit.target: Select animation asset

trans-unit.source: !Note For instructions about how import animations, see Import animations.
trans-unit.target: !Note For instructions about how import animations, see Import animations.

trans-unit.source: In the Property Grid, enable Root motion.
trans-unit.target: In the Property Grid, enable Root motion.

trans-unit.source: Enable root motion
trans-unit.target: Enable root motion

trans-unit.source: When root motion is enabled, Stride applies the root node animation to the TransformComponent of the entity you add the animation to, instead of applying it to the skeleton.
trans-unit.target: When root motion is enabled, Stride applies the root node animation to the TransformComponent of the entity you add the animation to, instead of applying it to the skeleton.

trans-unit.source: !Note If there is no skeleton specified in Skeleton, Stride always applies the animation to TransformComponent, even if root motion is disabled.
trans-unit.target: !Note If there is no skeleton specified in Skeleton, Stride always applies the animation to TransformComponent, even if root motion is disabled.

trans-unit.source: Attach the camera to a node on another model
trans-unit.target: Attach the camera to a node on another model

trans-unit.source: To move a camera in tandem with another model, create a separate entity for the camera, then use a model node link component to link the entity to the correct node.
trans-unit.target: To move a camera in tandem with another model, create a separate entity for the camera, then use a model node link component to link the entity to the correct node.

trans-unit.source: To do this, you need the following assets in your project:
trans-unit.target: To do this, you need the following assets in your project:

trans-unit.source: a camera entity, the camera you want to animate
trans-unit.target: a camera entity, the camera you want to animate

trans-unit.source: a model, to attach the camera to
trans-unit.target: a model, to attach the camera to

trans-unit.source: a skeleton that matches the model
trans-unit.target: a skeleton that matches the model

trans-unit.source: an animation, to animate the model
trans-unit.target: an animation, to animate the model

trans-unit.source: an animation script, to play the animation
trans-unit.target: an animation script, to play the animation

trans-unit.source: !Note FOV and near or far plane animations are ignored if you use this method.
trans-unit.target: !Note FOV and near or far plane animations are ignored if you use this method.

trans-unit.source: In the Asset View, select the model you want to link the camera to. Next to Skeleton, make sure a skeleton is specified that matches the model.
trans-unit.target: In the Asset View, select the model you want to link the camera to. Next to Skeleton, make sure a skeleton is specified that matches the model.

trans-unit.source: Make sure the entity you want to attach the camera to has the model, animation clip, and animation script components needed to animate it.
trans-unit.target: Make sure the entity you want to attach the camera to has the model, animation clip, and animation script components needed to animate it.

trans-unit.source: !Note For instructions about how to add these, see Animation.
trans-unit.target: !Note For instructions about how to add these, see Animation.

trans-unit.target: Add component
